title: cyrillic ot feature support
content:
since the current iteration of Adobe CS products doesn’t support script (or language) tags, what is the best way to get contextual cyrillic lookups to work in InDesign?

 [‹ Font Explorer X OT Feature Preview](http://web.archive.org/web/20070811194104/http:/typophile.com/node/18684 "Go to previous forum topic") [Justified Text in Adobe InDesign ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070811194104/http:/typophile.com/node/18656 "Go to next forum topic")
author: paul d hunt

comments.content:
Include them under the latn script and dflt language tags.

Adobe’s practice in this regard is to duplicate all lookups across all script and language tags except for those that are intended to differ (e.g. locl feature lookups).

Paul! You’re not right — in CS/CS2 works all, except only feature locl. But, remember that You must always use directive

languagesystem cyrl dflt;
